pros: great coworkers. great vacation opportunities. decent benefits package. faculty have a lot of free reign with their curriculum, and how they proctor classes.
cons: students will drive you insane. tons of red tape. professor wages are lower than the expected wages of their students upon graduation. challenging budgets.

pros: good benefits, nice working conditions, campus atmosphere, opportunity for advancement. everyone is very nice for the most part.   lots of campus activities to participate in .get extra time off at the holidays which is a nice time to be at home with family.
cons: because this is a state agency the pay rates do not compare with comparable jobs in local government or business.

pros: Small community, tight colleague group.

job_title: English As A Second Language Instructor (Adjunct Faculty) in Lewiston, ID
pros: What a great environment! People are friendly and care about both your personal interests as wel your professional interests and advancement. The weather is wonderful. Small campus. If you can secure one of the higher paid positions, you'll love it.
cons: Just slightly low pay. Improves with experience, particularly with a Master's degree.

pros: to be able to help other college students learn the skills and concepts that each student must learn about the student's chosen degree while providing a study friendly environment.
